title: Lima Gourmet Food Tour: Evening Experience
description: Combine sightseeing in Lima with a gourmet dining experience—food tastings, dinner, and drinks included. A guide accompanies your small group of 10 or less on an evening walking tour of the Barranco district, followed by a trendy beachfront bar at sunset. Dine amid illuminated pre-Incan ruins. It’s an experience not to be missed.
all_descriptions: Combine sightseeing in Lima with a gourmet dining experience—food tastings, dinner, and drinks included. A guide accompanies your small group of 10 or less on an evening walking tour of the Barranco district, followed by a trendy beachfront bar at sunset. Dine amid illuminated pre-Incan ruins. It’s an experience not to be missed.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productStop At:Costa Verde, Beach Road, Lima PeruThis tour begins at an upscale restaurant and lounge that sits right on the beach. With spectacular views of Lima’s coastline, Cala is a spot you won’t soon forget. Here you'll taste Peru's famous pisco and learn a thing or two to impress your friends with a new cocktail when you get home. This lively libation is accompanied a delicious seaside bite to kick the evening off!Duration: 1 hourStop At:Huaca Pucllana, Calle General Borgono s/n, cuadra 8, Lima 15074 PeruThe next stop is a well-known classic among Lima locals, the prestigious Huaca Pucllana Restaurant, located within an archaeological complex with illuminated ruins dating back to 500 A.D. Here you will enjoy a selection of Peruvian dishes paired with a natural wine from an award-winning local vineyard from the Pisco Valley. The combination of views and flavors makes this a stop you can't dare to miss during your Peru trip.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Miraflores District, Lima PeruBeyond Lima: Coast, Andes, and Amazon. Indulge in a curated tasting menu showcasing flavors from Peru’s diverse regions, expertly paired with a one-of-a-kind native Peruvian potato spirit for a unique and immersive culinary experience.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Barranco, Lima PeruPeru's Sweetest Flavors: Indulge in artisanal chocolate paired with Peru’s signature mistela spirit, enjoying each bite while soaking in the flavors of Barranco's vibrant, bohemian atmosphere.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Bridge of Sighs, Jr. Batallon, Ayacucho 271, Lima 15063 PeruTo wrap up the night, you’ll head to the bohemian Barranco district. You'll stroll around to check out the district's main attractions, like the Bridge of Sighs and all its legends, under the light of the moon.Duration: 1 hour
provider:
The Lima Gourmet Company

reviews.title: Excellent evening in Lima with Amy
reviews.text: We went out with Amy on our first night in Lima for this truly excellent food tour.  Every part of the experience was excellent - guide,cocktails, food, and environments.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Amazing food and tour guide!
reviews.text: Amazing food, and very knowledgeable and fantastic tour guide!A good combination of culinary experience and local history.

reviews.title: AMAZING food and experience
reviews.text: We had an excellent tour with Sue! All of the food we tried was absolutely delicious and our guide was very knowledgable about all the food and all of our Peru questions. We highly recommend this tour during your time in Lima - you will learn a lot, have a lot of fun, and eat AMAZING food.

reviews.title: Great evening. Well arranged. Great guide - Patricia.
reviews.text: We enjoyed our experience. Patricia our guide was great. Her spoken English was very good and very informative.  The tour arrangements were well arranged and Patricia handled the group well.Our favourite restaurant was Cala next to the coast - it was very atmospheric.  The ceviche was delicious and we lived the Pisco cocktail.

reviews.title: Beyond 5 stars
reviews.text: This tour completely blew us away! My partner and I had an amazing time, and I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.Let’s start with the tour itself. 4 beautiful venues each one with tastings of so many different delicious Peruvian dishes (of ample portion sizes!). In every location we got a description of the food, the venue’s location and its significance in Peruvian history. We ate by the seaside, next to historical ruins, and in the city’s cultural and artistic center. Each meal was accompanied by a pairing of a beverage, and even the drinks were expertly tailored to suit the food.Now I have to talk about the tour guide, Sue. Sue is by far my favorite tour guide I’ve had in Peru. Not only was she extremely knowledgeable, she is also incredibly passionate about her country, her culture and the food, and this made the experience so much richer for us. She was also so considerate of the different dietary restrictions in our small group, making on-the-fly adjustments to the menu to suit not only the restrictions but even the food preferences. I have a severe nut allergy and I felt very safe with Sue - At each venue she reconfirmed with the wait staff that the food had been prepared to be free of any cross-contamination so I could comfortably try new things I would otherwise have been wary of.We topped the tour off with a small stroll through Barranco. This was the third time we had visited Barranco during our stay in Peru and I had thought it would be a little repetitive. Somehow however, Sue was able to show us things we hadn’t seen and teach us new things about this beautiful area. She had such a unique and interesting perspective.I will end by saying when I first saw this tour I hesitated a little at the price, but let me tell you - if you love food, drinks, learning about history and culture, and spending a wonderful evening in great company - do not hesitate, it is well worth the money, and this is the tour for you!!

reviews.title: Good times, great food!
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our tour- a smooth, professional operation.  I would highly  recommend to anyone new to Lima wanting to explore Barranco and Miraflores.

reviews.title: Fantastic and beyond expectations
reviews.text: Our food tour with Patricia Vasquez was nothing short of amazing. Each restaurant was unique and each menu item was a delight. We enjoyed the experience in all four restaurants that we toured and Patricia did a great job making sure all of our dietary needs were met.

reviews.title: Culinary Tour in Lima
reviews.text: We were so lucky to reserve a culinary tour with Patricia Vasquez during our trip to Peru, and it ended up being one of the highlights of our visit! Every stop offered incredible food, along with delicious cocktails and wine, and Patricia made sure all of our food preferences were taken into account.  The tour was seamless from start to finish, and we especially loved receiving the follow-up email with all the details of the restaurants and dishes we experienced.  Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Evening Gourmet Food Tour
reviews.text: Our guide Sue was excellent. The evening was fun and informative. We learned lots of history and ate authentic, yummy food. Well worth it!

reviews.title: Amazing Food Tour
reviews.text: I went on this tour on August 2025 on the first day in Lima. It was very well organized, the food was amazing and the small size of the group made the difference in the experience. Patricia was very knowledgeable about each dish and clearly excited to be with us. She was also happy to help make recommendations for the rest of my trip. I would highly recommend the tour as a starting point for the food experience in Lima.
